title: Mechanical System Engineer (m/f/d)
description:
Company Description

Here at Volocopter, we are the pioneers of electric air taxis (electric vertical takeoff and landing aircraft - eVTOLs). We have pledged to bring sustainable urban air mobility to life by getting electric air taxis off the ground in a way that complements existing transportation options in megacities across the globe. In 2011 we carried out the first-ever crewed flight of a fully electric multicopter and have since conducted more than 2,000 public and private test flights across the world (www.volocopter.com).

Job Description

Your crew during this flight:

As a systems engineer for mechanical systems, you will be part of a dynamic and driven team responsible for defining requirements, devising verification strategies, and conducting corresponding test campaigns. Your role will also involve ensuring that all equipment sourced from suppliers align with the specific needs and requirements of Volocopter.

Your mission during this flight:

The role of a system engineer involves overseeing the development, verification, and testing of the internally and externally developed mechanical elements of the aircraft, to ensure it meets all product and certification requirements. You will work closely with your team to optimize the system definition, requirements, and verification, taking into account key factors such as usability, maintenance, costs, and timelines.

You will be responsible for defining testing requirements for both development and verification phases. Ultimately, your efforts will play a vital role in ensuring that the mechanical elements meet stakeholders' expectations and perform to the highest aerospace standards.

You will work autonomously and provide guidance to the rest of the system engineering team as well as other interfaces that depend on the systems engineering process. You will define development and verification strategies, and have a high influence on the development of our mechanical systems.

Your responsibilities will be:


 * Generation and optimization of system engineering processes required to develop structures and mechanical components.
 * Definition, specification, and development assurance for mechanical elements.
 * Verification strategy definition - develop a plan for meeting the requirements, including certification plans and exchanges with the certification authority (e.g. EASA)
 * Structural testing definition and supervision: oversee the testing process to ensure compliance, and address any deviations or non-compliances.
 * Lifecycle management of supplier systems.
   
   

Qualifications

Check in your professional skills:


 * Mechanical or Aerospace Engineering degree (M.Sc., Ph.D.)
 * Minimum 5+ years of professional experience as a systems engineer in mechanical systems in aerospace industry.
 * Proven experience in aircraft development on lightweight composite structures and rotors.
 * Experience with supplier selection, evaluation, and management.
 * Experience with mechanical systems and/or structures certification.
 * Experience in certification according to aerospace standards.
 * A structured way of working and a high sense of accountability.
 * Experience with prototyping and testing.
 * Excellent communication skills with internal and external stakeholders.
   
   

Preferred skills:


 * 7+ years of experience as a systems engineer in mechanical systems in aerospace industry.
 * Hand-on, creative, pragmatic and solution-oriented way of working in cross functional teams.
 * Open-minded and willing to think outside the box.
 * Good understanding light structures and aircraft mechanical systems and certification process.
 * Technical project management experience.
 * Experience with aerospace standards: CS23, CS25, CS27, CS29, SC-VTOL.
   
   

Additional Information

OurVolocopterflight includes:


 * Fast-growing high-tech company with a superb network of investors and partners 
 * Chance to shape the future of aviation
 * Help us to create groundbreaking new projects - from scratch! 
 * Personal accountability, as well as growth and learning opportunities, based on your personal strengths
 * An inspiring workplace with modern workspaces, flexible hours, quick decision-making, a flat hierarchy, positive leadership, great team spirit
 * Attractive compensation package
   
   

Diversity atVolocopter:

Our differences are what make us great.Here at Volocopter, we value equal opportunities and trust. As air mobility industry innovators, we believe that changing the world starts on team level.We are committed to fosteringanenvironment where everyone feels valued, respected, and empoweredtoreach their full potential.

title: Solutions Engineer (m/f/d)
description:
About Zeotap

Founded in Berlin in 2014, Zeotap started with a mission to provide high-quality data to marketers. As we evolved, we recognized a greater challenge: helping brands create personalized, multi-channel experiences in a world that demands strict data privacy and compliance. This drive led to the launch of Zeotap’s Customer Data Platform (CDP) in 2020—a powerful, AI-native SaaS suite built on Google Cloud that empowers brands to unlock and activate customer data securely.

Today, Zeotap is trusted by some of the world’s most innovative brands, including Virgin Media O2, Amazon, and Audi, to create engaging, data-driven customer experiences that drive better business outcomes across marketing, sales, and service. With an unique background in high-quality data solutions, Zeotap is a leader in the European CDP market, empowering enterprises with a secure, privacy-first solution to harness the full potential of their customer data.

The Role

As a pre-sales Solutions Engineer specialist (SE), you will be a part of an innovative group of Zeotap technologists that support Sales & Success organizations to develop and implement strategies to take their prospects and customers to a new level of performance and outcomes. Solutioning is fundamental to the role and will include assisting the customer, Account Executives, and Customer Success Managers with the discovery, analysis, and recommendation of strategic solutions across many different industries, verticals, and segments. These solutions will leverage Zeotap technologies to address the core advertising and marketing challenges and objectives that are uniquely identified for each customer.

A Zeotap SE works in a dynamic, fast growth environment where their expertise in design, business consulting, and technology is leveraged every day to drive customer success and ACV.

You will be aligned to a specific territory and/or region of Zeotap where you will closely collaborate with Sales and Success account teams and their leadership to execute growth strategies that result in customer success + revenue growth.

You will lead yourself and your teammates to properly prepare for any customer-facing engagement as well as work cross-functionally with stakeholders and corporate resources as needed to create and close the pipeline.

You will give and receive clear and honest feedback and flawlessly execute our sales processes to surpass your assigned ACV targets.

In this role you will report on all sales activity and forecast directly to the Head of Solutions Engineering.

Your Impact

This is an incredibly important role as you will directly impact the growth and trajectory of Zeotap. You will be masterful with internal and external engagements and put the customer in the center of everything you do. You will work closely and collaborate with the Zeotap ecosystem to inspire them to support you so you can exceed your assigned quota.

Responsibilities


 * Zeotap SE’s are leaders – they epitomize our 4 core values (Trustworthy, Adaptive, Pioneer & Challenger) while they map account strategies, align resources, and act as an extension of their customers. They partner with customers and collaborate with internal teammates to drive consensus on multi-product technology solutions across Zeotap’s product lines.
   
   
   

They work very closely with Sales & Success, product specialists, marketing, and executives to work on a wide array of assignments including business development, operations and IT strategies, as well as executive level product demonstrations to achieve the following:


 * Help define, manage, and execute the growth strategy and performance of a territory
 * Increase awareness of the entire suite of Zeotap solutions across all accounts of your assigned territory
 * Understand your customer’s business(es) and how it operates & the priorities that drive decisions
 * Create demand by discovering business problems or opportunities and aligning them to our solution(s.)
 * Build credibility and trust with necessary external stakeholders to influence buying decisions to drive credibility and trust in your territory
 * Take both ambiguous and complex business problems and using research and business assessment capabilities, define the problem, drive innovative ideas, define the opportunity set, and recommend actionable next steps
 * Bring rigor to a customer’s decision making process by evaluating and presenting solution options and in doing so, drive consensus among key stakeholders.
 * Collaborate with customers to develop new decision frameworks and governance processes that continue to deliver value beyond a particular engagement or bundle of solutions
 * Support the generation of pipeline that results in over-achievement of quota while exceeding CSAT scores
 * Collaborate with internal resources & external partners in order to drive additional value to the customer
 * Demonstrate through Zeotap software demonstrations and rapid prototyping how connected experiences come to life with Zeotap. This includes but is not limited to the delivery of executive level demonstrations, construction of future state customer journey strategies, and developing IT roadmaps
 * Accurately report and forecast activity to regional and executive leadership
 * Learn and distribute market intelligence to your team(s) and greater Zeotap ecosystem
 * Adhere to Zeotap’s company, privacy and information security policies and procedures.
 * Complete all the awareness trainings assigned on time
 * Become the trusted advisor of your territory.
   
   
   

Requirements


 * At least 3-5 years of field experience supporting sales functions either as a Solutions Engineer or Solutions Consultant, selling & solutioning digital advertising & marketing technologies like DMP, CDP, CMP, and/or CRM solutions, programmatic digital data products and comparable marketing or advertising SaaS solutions to every level of a marketing or advertising organization across a variety of industries and verticals.
 * You will also have a successful history of creating market opportunities and are comfortable selling & solutioning in a wide variety of arenas from the C-suite to industry events and have the ability to create, support, and/or deliver impactful presentations accordingly
 * Mandatory: Fluency in English and German, additional language would be a plus
   
   
   

Across all Sales & Success teams, we are looking for the following attributes:


 * Business Acumen: the ability to engage at every level of a business and understand how to translate business problems and/or initiatives into software solutions.
 * Technical Acumen: a strong understanding of user research, user-centric design principles, and online consumer behavior that leverages 1P – 3P data
 * Industry Expertise: proven experience leading strategy and digital roadmap projects in complex business and marketing environments
 * Consultative Selling: the ability to put the customer’s requirements first to focus on solutioning their needs with expertise in organizational design consulting, process design and optimization, digital governance, and team dynamics to analyze, structure, and negotiate long-term technology roadmaps with customers.
 * Change Agent: Demonstrated success driving organizational change within customer organizations and can understand, communicate, and manage across the entire project lifestyle
 * Prospecting Skills: a relentless search to find new customers and expand the value for existing ones
 * Compelling & Effective Communicator: an outstanding communicator with excellent presentation skills; dynamic and persuasive in presenting ideas to prospective and existing customers across multiple levels of business stakeholders while also working with product and systems owners to drive change
 * Urgency: a persistent drive to execute swiftly and effectively manage time
 * Competitive Spirit: an enthusiasm for competition and over-performance
 * Self Enabler and Learner: you have and curate a broad knowledge of relevant technology trends
 * Collaborative: you are easy to do business with and encourage and facilitate teamwork to drive customer & Zeotap success
 * Resourceful: the ability to overcome obstacles without sacrificing policy or process
 * Coachable: a life-long passion for learning and providing feedback
   
   
   

What do we offer?


 * Competitive compensation & benefits
 * Unmatched Global support system and Remote-first organisation
 * Fast-paced, collaborative & fun culture
 * Exposure & access to industry experts & teammates that live our values
 * Work with very driven entrepreneurs & a network of global senior investors across Telco, Data, Advertising & Technology
   
   
   

Zeotap welcomes all – we are equal employment opportunity & affirmative action employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status.

Interested in joining us?

We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Senior Agent Engineer
description:
About Beam

Beam is a tech start-up revolutionizing business operations with AI. Our AI Agents empower organizations by automating repetitive tasks, boosting productivity in seconds. With seamless integration into business applications, our agents provide support where teams need it most. Our mission? To transform business practices, increase efficiency, improve competitiveness, and scale operations globally.

To learn more about us, please visit our website at https://www.beam.ai/

About The Role

As a Senior Agent Engineer at Beam, you will play a key role in delivering enterprise-grade AI agents tailored to address our customers' unique business challenges. You'll partner directly with clients to discover their requirements, design customized solutions, and ensure the seamless implementation of AI agents, and collaborate with our product team to shape our strategic direction in the adoption of AI-powered solutions.

We're looking for someone who thrives in an environment where ownership, creativity, and technical leadership are celebrated. If you're passionate about pushing the boundaries of AI and enjoy solving real-world challenges, this is the role for you.

Responsibilities

Your work will involve both engineering excellence and close customer collaboration, bridging the gap between product and business strategy. You will be expected to:


 * Drive the entire lifecycle of AI Agent deployment—from understanding customer requirements, through solution design, to hands-on implementation
 * Be at the cutting edge of AI, using Generative AI models to solve critical business problems and driving new features that impact the future of Beam's AI platform
 * Engage directly with customers across technical and executive teams, helping them discover automation opportunities and building AI solutions that enhance their operations
 * Collaborate closely with product, engineering, and solutions teams to scope, define, and implement new features that tackle innovation gaps and enhance the customer experience
 * Design AI Agents that are scalable, efficient, and seamlessly integrate into customer workflows, ensuring a smooth user experience
 * Troubleshoot technical issues and provide expert guidance to customers and internal teams throughout the implementation process
 * Act as a strategic technical partner, advising customers on best practices, identifying opportunities for deeper AI integration, and driving the adoption of solutions that align with their long-term goals
 * Contribute to shaping the the direction of our AI Platform by providing feedback based on real-world use cases and customer insights
   
   
   

Requirements


 * Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Artificial Intelligence, or a related field. Advanced degree (Master's or Ph.D.) preferred
 * Minimum 5 years of proven experience in technical roles such as Software Development, Solutions Engineer, Implementation Engineer, or similar, with a focus on customer-facing technical support or solution design
 * Experienced in Prompt Engineering, with the ability to design, refine, and optimize AI prompts for AI/LLM applications
 * Experience engaging with enterprise-level customers, from gathering requirements to delivering tailored solutions
 * Ability to troubleshoot and resolve complex technical challenges in collaboration with both internal and external teams
 * Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to simplify complex concepts for diverse stakeholders
 * Passion for innovation and staying ahead of trends in AI technologies and customer engagement strategies
   
   
   

Good to have:


 * Experience with backend tech stacks such as Python, JavaScript, and TypeScript
 * Familiarity with cloud platforms such as AWS, GCP or Azure. API integrations is a plus
 * Strong understanding of AI, machine learning concepts, and their practical applications in business processes
   
   
   

Why Beam?

At Beam, we foster a culture of ownership and growth, giving you the freedom to take charge of your work and make a meaningful impact on the future of AI. As part of a highly collaborative, fast-paced startup, you'll have the opportunity to work at the forefront of AI innovation, designing and building solutions that address real-world business challenges.

We offer more than just a job. Here, you'll find:


 * Ownership and autonomy: You'll have the opportunity to own the full lifecycle of projects, from conception to execution, and see your work directly impact businesses worldwide
 * Personal and professional growth: We encourage continuous learning and innovation. Whether you're advancing in your technical expertise, growing your leadership skills, or shaping the next generation of AI solutions, your growth is our priority
 * Being at the cutting edge: You'll be working with the latest AI technologies, driving innovation in generative AI and natural language processing
 * Competitive benefits and stock options: We offer a competitive salary, stock options, and comprehensive benefits to ensure you're not only rewarded today but also invested in the future of the company
 * Collaborative Culture: You'll work alongside brilliant minds in an agile, collaborative, and supportive startup environment, where your ideas can truly make a difference
   
   

If you are passionate about leveraging AI to drive innovation and thrive in a collaborative, fast-paced environment, we'd love to hear from you! Join us in shaping the future of AI-powered solutions!

title: (Senior) Site Reliability Engineer (d/f/m)
description:
Reliability is your second name?

Paymenttools is on a mission to transform the payment landscape for retailers in Europe. With more than 4,4 billion visitors per year in our more than 15,000 REWE Group stores and travel agencies in 21 countries we know exactly what consumers and merchants need when exchanging goods for money. We strongly believe in making payments seamless and invisible, linking them with value added services within the framework of a reliable identity service. Our mantra: #wesolvepayn. We blend cutting-edge technology with stringent security to protect sensitive payment data while nurturing innovation in a cloud-native tech environment.

We are seeking experienced Site Reliability Engineers (m/f/d) to join our newly formed SRE team and help us ensure that our payment systems and tools are reliable, scalable, observable, and secure. The SRE will collaborate with product teams to design, implement, and maintain infrastructure, tooling, and processes that support our mission-critical payment applications and services. Ideally, you have a strong background in software- and infrastructure-engineering.

You will be facing the exciting challenge to build and establish SRE as a new paradigm at paymenttools. This includes mentoring product teams in their reliability mindset, continuous onboarding of new systems into SRE, partnering with infrastructure teams for required capabilities, and participating in on-call rotations.

We are looking forward to getting to know you - so, even if you feel that you don’t quite meet all the requirements, but the position still excites you and you think you would love to work with us, please reach out! We would still love to hear from you. We explicitly encourage applicants within groups that are underrepresented in tech spaces as of today. We value all kinds of backgrounds and walks of life.

Your Tasks


 * You collaborate with and mentor product teams to establish reliability and production standards for their services.
 * You implement, automate and improve our services, infrastructure, tools, tasks and processes to improve efficiency and reduce errors/toil.
 * You identify, monitor, measure, and optimize important metrics to our systems.
 * You participate in on-call rotation and resolve incidents across services and levels of the stack.
 * You foster a culture of continuous learning from our incidents and how to avoid them in the future.
 * It is important for you to ensure compliance with security and regulatory requirements for our payment systems.
 * You drive projects End-to-End.
   
   

Your Experience


 * You have multiple years of relevant experience as a Site Reliability Engineer, DevOps Engineer— or in an equivalent role designing, building, and operating large-scale production systems
 * You are proficient in at least one programming language (e.g. Go, Java, Python)
 * You are experienced with cloud and containers, we use GCP, Kubernetes
 * You have experience with IaC, we use Terraform
 * You know your way around observability and what to measure and how (e.g. Prometheus, Grafana, Loki, Golden Signals, SLOs, error budgets)
 * You communicate fluently and to the point in English at all levels of the organization
   
   

Our Benefits


 * Deutschland ticket, subsidized subscription
 * 1.000 euro annual learning and development budget + internal training platforms
 * Discounts on travel, fashion, technology, and more through our corporate benefits
 * REWE discount card for discounts for REWE group retailers
 * JobRad, affordable bicycle leasing!
 * Company pension plan
 * Insurance Services
   
   

Perks Of Working With Us


 * We work in a hybrid environment
 * Flexible working hours that fit your workflow, your time matters!
 * Responsibility from day one
 * Work with modern and agile software such as Google Workspace, Slack, Asana, Jira, Lattice, Miro and Confluence
 * Company events including Hackathons and Company Days
 * Ask us more about these!

title: Junior Software Engineer (5213)
System Engineer
description:
Our client is seeking a Network Engineer with strong Linux and networking knowledge, along with scripting language experience, to join their team in Munich, Germany. The role is hybrid, requiring both on-site and remote work. The ideal candidate will have proficiency in German (B2) and English (C1), with extensive knowledge of Linux systems, networks, and automation tools.

Technologies


 * Python, Bash, Perl
 * Linux (Debian, CentOS)
 * Git
 * MySQL
   
   

Requirements


 * 3+ years of programming experience in at least one scripting language (Bash, Perl, or Python preferred).
 * Strong Linux and networking knowledge, with command line proficiency.
 * Experience with Icinga, Puppet, Hiera, Linux KVM, Git, Facter, Ansible, or MySQL is a plus.
 * Knowledge of monitoring tools, switches, routers, firewalls, and load balancers.
 * German (B2 level) and English (C1 level) proficiency required.
 * Ability to work hybridly in Munich, Germany.
   
   

Responsibilities


 * Plan, design, and maintain the company's intercontinental network across six global locations.
 * Optimize the data center packet switching infrastructure for reliability, low latency, and throughput.
 * Ensure network security using OpenBSD firewalls and connect to customers via leased lines and VPN.
 * Extend and develop automated network configuration tools using 100% open-source software (e.g., Ansible, Python).
 * Participate in a rotating on-call system (about one week every five, fully compensated).
 * Assist with maintaining around 600 Linux servers (Debian 12, CentOS 8).
 * Opportunity to broaden skills by learning new technologies such as Kubernetes and Puppet.
   
   

Skills: linux kvm,kubernetes,firewalls,git,facter,python,vpn,scripting,networking,ansible,perl,bash,openbsd,switches,puppet,icinga,linux,hiera,monitoring tools,routers,mysql,load balancers

title: System Engineer Motor (m/f/d)
description:
Company Description

Here at Volocopter, we are the pioneers of electric air taxis (electric vertical takeoff and landing aircraft - eVTOLs). We have pledged to bring sustainable urban air mobility to life by getting electric air taxis off the ground in a way that complements existing transportation options in megacities across the globe. In 2011 we carried out the first-ever crewed flight of a fully electric multicopter and have since conducted more than 2,000 public and private test flights across the world (www.volocopter.com).

Job Description

We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated System Engineer to join our team, with a specialized focus on motor development for aerospace applications. As a System Engineer, you will play a key role in the overall understanding, verification, and validation of motor systems for aircraft. Your expertise in aerospace standards, supplier management, and knowledge of electronics and embedded software development will contribute to the successful development of advanced motor systems.

Your mission during this flight:


 * Collaborate closely with multidisciplinary teams to gain a comprehensive understanding of motor systems, including electrical, mechanical, and software components, within the aerospace context.
 * Define and establish system-level requirements, ensuring compliance with aerospace standards and customer specifications.
 * Lead the verification and validation activities for motor systems, including developing test plans, conducting testing, and analyzing test data to ensure system performance and safety.
 * Coordinate with external suppliers to manage the development and integration of motor components, ensuring alignment with program milestones and quality standards.
 * Conduct detailed technical reviews of supplier documents, such as requirement specifications, design descriptions, and test procedures.
 * Collaborate with internal stakeholders to identify and resolve system-level issues and challenges, applying sound engineering principles and practices.
 * Contribute to the development and improvement of system engineering processes, methodologies, and tools, with a focus on motor systems for aerospace applications.
 * Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in aerospace standards, regulations, and industry best practices, applying them to enhance motor system development.
   
   

Qualifications

Check in your professional skills:


 * Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering, Aerospace Engineering, or a related field. Advanced degree preferred.
 * At least 5 year of experience in system engineering within the aerospace industry, specifically in motor development.
 * In-depth knowledge of aerospace standards and regulations (e.g., ARP4754A), with a focus on motor systems.
 * Experience in verification and validation activities for safety-critical systems, preferably within the aerospace domain.
 * Familiarity with supplier management, including managing external suppliers and ensuring their adherence to program requirements.
 * Knowledge of electronics and embedded software development for motor systems, enabling effective collaboration with cross-functional teams.
 * Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to analyze complex systems and propose innovative solutions.
 * Strong organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple tasks and priorities effectively.
 * Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to collaborate and present technical information to diverse stakeholders.
 * Fluent in English.
   
   

Preferred Skills:


 * Experience in motor design and analysis, including electrical and mechanical aspects.
 * Familiarity with model-based systems engineering methodologies and tools.
 * Knowledge of aerospace hardware development processes and quality standards, including DO-178 and DO-254.
 * Understanding of safety assessment methodologies such as FMEA and FTA.
 * Proficiency in using requirements management tools (e.g., DOORS) and configuration management tools.
 * Experience with system-level integration and testing of motor systems for aircraft.
   
   

Additional Information

OurVolocopterflight includes:


 * Fast-growing high-tech company with a superb network of investors and partners 
 * Chance to shape the future of aviation
 * Help us to create groundbreaking new projects - from scratch! 
 * Personal accountability, as well as growth and learning opportunities, based on your personal strengths
 * An inspiring workplace with modern workspaces, flexible hours, quick decision-making, a flat hierarchy, positive leadership, great team spirit
 * Attractive compensation package
   
   

Diversity atVolocopter:

Our differences are what make us great.Here at Volocopter, we value equal opportunities and trust. As air mobility industry innovators, we believe that changing the world starts on team level.We are committed to fosteringanenvironment where everyone feels valued, respected, and empoweredtoreach their full potential.

title: Lead Engineer
description:

title: Requirements Engineer (m/f/d)
description:
At the headquarters in Ottobrunn near Munich, the Porsche eBike Performance GmbH develops, produces and markets advanced drive systems for two brands: FAZUA with the focus on pioneering compact lightweights for agile e-bikes and under the brand name Porsche exceptionally powerful drive systems. FAZUA is a young, ambitious brand that has transformed the cycling industry in 2017 with its innovative drive system for agile, compact, lightweight (and extremely good looking) e-bikes. Since July 2022, we are a part of the Porsche eBike Performance GmbH through the takeover by Porsche AG. Our diverse, open-minded, ambitious (and fun) team is constantly seeking new, inspiring talents who will help us push boundaries to shape the future of e-bike technology.

Aufgaben


 * Requirement Gathering: Collaborate with stakeholders, including product managers, development and test teams, to elicit and document technical requirements and specifications. Driving technical requirements generation from business and product requirements
 * Classic System Requirements Analysis: Perform system requirements analysis based on stakeholder requirements and in coordination with system and software architects
 * Documentation: Document requirements at the system level and support departments in creating domain-specific requirements. Create comprehensive and detailed requirement documents, including specifications, use cases, and process flows
 * Communication: Serve as a liaison between stakeholders and development teams, ensuring clear and continuous communication throughout the project lifecycle
 * Coordination and Support: Organize and coordinate requirements reviews. Provide support in planning and estimating work packages concerning time and resource requirements for requirements engineering.
 * Requirements Baselines: Implement and manage requirements baselines
 * Quality Assurance: Work with Test and QA teams to ensure that requirements are testable and that testing plans align with requirement specifications
 * Stakeholder Management: Build and maintain strong relationships with stakeholders to understand their needs and expectations. Facilitate meetings and workshops to gather feedback and discuss requirements.
 * Project Support: Provide ongoing support to project teams by ensuring clear requirements, assisting in troubleshooting issues, and ensuring that requirements are met.
 * Reporting: Regularly report on the progress of the processing in the project based on KPIs yet to be defined
 * Best Practices: Stay updated on industry best practices and methodologies related to requirements management and apply them to improve processes. Support the development and design of the requirements engineering process
 * Process Identification: Identify and introduce necessary requirements management processes, tools, and development methods for R&D departments
 * Project-Specific Requirements Engineering: Take responsibility for project-specific requirements engineering in development projects
 * Technical Changes: Coordinate and manage technical changes
 * Infrastructure Creation: Create tool-based and project-specific infrastructure
   
   

Profil


 * Bachelor's degree or higher education in Engineering, Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field.
 * Minimum of 5 years of experience in Systems Engineering, Requirements Management or similar position
 * Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
 * Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
 * Experience with best practices for writing requirements (INOSE, EARS, etc.)
 * Proficiency in requirements management tools (DOORS, Jama, etc.)
 * Experience with process assessment and lifecycle standards (ISO 33004, ISO 12207, ISO 15288, ASPICE, etc.)
 * Experience with Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC) and V-model processes.
 * Ability to manage multiple priorities for multiple projects simultaneously.
 * Strong interpersonal skills and ability to work well with cross-functional teams.
 * Detail-oriented with a strong focus on quality and accuracy.
 * Bonus points:
    * Experience with e-bike or automotive industry projects.
    * Familiarity with agile methodologies and tools.
    * Certified in requirements management or business analysis (CBAP, PMI-PBA, etc.).
    * Experience with Model Based System Engineering Requirements Generation.
    * German language skills are an advantage.

Dein Profil

Als „System Engineer“ steigst Du in die spannende Welt des technischen Projektgeschehens ein, kannst eigene Ideen in Projekte einfließen lassen und Deine Fähigkeiten in vielseitigen Aufgaben einsetzen. Klingt gut? Damit überzeugst Du uns von Dir:

title: System Engineer - Connectivity & IoT (m/f/d)
description:
Company Description

Here at Volocopter, we are the pioneers of electric air taxis (electric vertical takeoff and landing aircraft - eVTOLs). We have pledged to bring sustainable urban air mobility to life by getting electric air taxis off the ground in a way that complements existing transportation options in megacities across the globe. In 2011 we carried out the first-ever crewed flight of a fully electric multicopter and have since conducted more than 2,000 public and private test flights across the world (www.volocopter.com).

Job Description

Your mission during this flight:

The purpose of this role is to ensure that the design of the system aligns with overall business objectives, regulatory requirements, and industry standards. The strategic contribution of this role is to ensure that the designed system maximizes value to the company and can be operated efficiently and effectively during its product lifecycle.


 * You will create architecture concepts for integration of various systems
 * You will manage functional and physical integration of systems on aircraft and ground segments
 * You will define and manage hardware and software interfaces
 * You will perform and review requirements decomposition
 * You will support functional decompositions to define aircraft and system functions
 * You will coordinate between multiple stakeholders, internal and external to Volocopter, for the success of our projects
 * You will adapt systems engineering in a pragmatic way to support team objectives and fast development
   
   

Qualifications

Check in your professional skills:


 * Master in Systems Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Aerospace Engineering, or similar
 * 3+ years of experience in hardware engineering and firmware development, with a focus on avionics systems
 * Strong understanding of UAS and support system functions and systems design
 * Strong understanding of avionics systems, including system-level design, integration, and testing
 * Model Based Systems Engineering (MBSE)
 * Experience in writing and managing requirements
 * Knowledge of regulatory and certification requirements for aviation products, such as RTCA/DO-178, RTCA/DO-254, and ARINC-429 as well as ARINC-825 beneficial
 * Knowledge of the following tools is highly beneficial: Windchill RV&S, Systems Modeling Language (SysML), Unified Modeling Language (UML), Capella, Basic CAD skills
 * Drone piloting experience is beneficial along with pilot license and radio license
 * The following soft skills are highly beneficial:
    * Excellent teamwork communication and collaboration skills,
    * Ability to work effectively in a cross-functional team environment,
    * Ability to manage varied tasks and prioritize workload,
    * Ability to work methodically in a fast-paced environment with evolving priorities.
      

Additional Information

Our Volocopter flight includes:


 * Fast-growing high-tech company with a superb network of investors and partners 
 * Chance to shape the future of aviation
 * Help us to create groundbreaking new projects - from scratch! 
 * Personal accountability, as well as growth and learning opportunities, based on your personal strengths
 * An inspiring workplace with modern workspaces, flexible hours, quick decision-making, a flat hierarchy, positive leadership, great team spirit
 * Attractive compensation package
   
   

Diversity at Volocopter:

Our differences are what make us great. Here at Volocopter, we value equal opportunities and trust. As air mobility industry innovators, we believe that changing the world starts on team level. We are committed to fostering an environment where everyone feels valued, respected, and empowered to reach their full potential.

description:

title: Requirements Engineer
description:
ECARX (Nasdaq: ECX) is a global mobility-tech company that partners with leading Original Equipment Manufacturers (OEMs) to reshape the automotive industry as it transitions toward an all-electric future. With innovative technology such as central computers, System-on-a-Chip (SoCs), and software solutions, ECARX is driving the next generation of in-car user experiences. Since its founding in 2017, ECARX has grown to nearly 2,000 employees, and its products have been integrated into over 5 million vehicles worldwide.

About The Role

We are seeking a Requirements Engineer to take ownership of gathering, defining, and managing stakeholder requirements throughout the lifecycle of our projects. In this role, you will collaborate with multiple teams to ensure that stakeholder needs are captured, validated, and met, thereby contributing to the success of our next-gen automotive solutions.

What You Will Do


 * Act as the primary point of contact for stakeholders on requirements engineering.
 * Define, tailor, and implement requirements engineering processes and tools based on specific project needs.
 * Lead requirements elicitation from the RFI/RFQ stage through to project completion.
 * Develop and maintain requirements specification baselines, ensuring accurate traceability throughout the project lifecycle.
 * Manage and support change requests, and conduct technical analysis with the engineering team.
 * Promote design reuse by identifying synergies and fostering the development of reusable requirements.
   
   

What You Need


 * Extensive experience in requirements engineering and the use of relevant tools.
 * Strong knowledge of embedded software and systems, particularly in the areas of infotainment or cockpits.
 * Familiarity with software and hardware architectures (e.g., SoC, MCU, Android, Linux).
 * Minimum of five years of experience in the automotive industry, with at least three years in requirements engineering.
 * Fluency in both German and English is required.

title: System Engineer (m/w/d) – Spitzentechnologie
description:
🎯 Position : Systems Engineer (m/w/d)

🚩 Standort : München

📝 Vertrag : Unbefristeter Vertrag (CDI)




Das Projekt:




Unser Kunde ist ein international führendes Unternehmen, das auf Netzwerktechnologien und Konnektivität spezialisiert ist. Es entwickelt innovative Lösungen, die die Art und Weise, wie Menschen und Unternehmen sich verbinden und zusammenarbeiten, neu definieren. Als Marktführer in seinem Bereich entwirft unser Kunde fortschrittliche Produkte wie hochmoderne Wi-Fi-Systeme, professionelle Netzwerkmanagement-Lösungen und intelligente Konnektivitätswerkzeuge.

Mit einem starken Fokus auf Leistung, Innovation und Benutzererfahrung schätzt das Unternehmen Kreativität und technische Expertise, um die technologischen Herausforderungen der Zukunft zu meistern. Möchten Sie Teil eines Unternehmens werden, in dem Ihre Ideen einen Unterschied machen können? Bewerben Sie sich jetzt und tragen Sie dazu bei, die Zukunft der Konnektivität mitzugestalten.




Was wir bieten:

 * Ein dynamisches und innovatives Arbeitsumfeld, das persönliches und berufliches Wachstum fördert.
 * Die Möglichkeit, an wertvollen Projekten in einer sich ständig weiterentwickelnden Technologiebranche zu arbeiten.
 * Ein Unternehmen, das technisches Fachwissen, Eigeninitiative und Zusammenarbeit im Team wertschätzt.




Hauptaufgabe:

Der Systems Engineer, EMEA, ist Teil der europäischen Organisation unseres Kunden. Er ist für die Pre-Sales-Aktivitäten und die Unterstützung von Partnern in Deutschland verantwortlich. Dazu gehört die Betreuung von Value-Added Resellern (VAR), Systemintegratoren und kommerziellen Endkunden. Diese kundenorientierte Rolle kombiniert technische Fähigkeiten mit Account Management.

Unser Kunde arbeitet mit einer Vielzahl von Partnern auf dem deutschen Markt zusammen, darunter langjährige Partner sowie neue strategische Partner, die die angebotenen technischen Möglichkeiten besser verstehen möchten.




Spezifische Aufgaben:

 * Unterstützung der Partner (Vor-Ort-Support, Schulungen und Sensibilisierung)
 * Technische Projektmanagement und Beratung für alle relevanten Projekte
 * Entwicklung von technischen Lösungen und Konzepten für VAR-Partner und kommerzielle Endkunden
 * Regelmäßige Schulungen in Präsenz und in Webinar-Format für das Vertriebsteam und die Partnerbasis
 * Repräsentation des Unternehmens auf Messen, Konferenzen, Partner- und Presseveranstaltungen
 * Beantwortung öffentlicher Ausschreibungen
 * Verwaltung und Unterstützung bei Produkttests und -bewertungen durch Kunden, einschließlich der Verantwortung für lokale Demo-Ausrüstung

title: Battery System Engineer (m/f/d)
description:
Company Description

Here at Volocopter, we are the pioneers of electric air taxis (electric vertical takeoff and landing aircraft - eVTOLs). We have pledged to bring sustainable urban air mobility to life by getting electric air taxis off the ground in a way that complements existing transportation options in megacities across the globe. In 2011 we carried out the first-ever crewed flight of a fully electric multicopter and have since conducted more than 2,000 public and private test flights across the world (www.volocopter.com).

Job Description

As a Battery System Engineer (m/f/d), you will play a crucial role in our mission to develop cutting-edge battery solutions for aerospace and safety-critical applications. Your extensive knowledge of system engineering processes and electrical engineering background will be instrumental in ensuring the reliability, safety, and performance of our battery systems.

Your mission during this flight:


 * System Engineering Expertise: Apply your substantial knowledge of system engineering processes to evaluate requirements, design descriptions, functions, and more at both the system and component levels. Ensure that our battery systems meet the highest safety and performance standards.
 * Aerospace and Safety-Critical Focus: Leverage your experience in aerospace or other safety-critical applications to align battery system development with industry-specific requirements and regulatory standards.
 * Electrical Engineering: Apply your electrical engineering background to contribute to the design and integration of electrical components within our battery systems.
 * Requirements Management: Handle internal system engineering processes aligned with development lifecycle needs, including rigorous requirements management and milestone deliverables.
 * Component Design Documentation: Take ownership of component design description documents and interface control documents to ensure the clarity and effectiveness of our designs.
 * Supplier Collaboration: Review and collaborate on supplier documents, such as requirement specifications and design descriptions, to maintain consistency and quality across the supply chain.
 * Validation and Verification: Specify and support the validation and verification activities of component requirements, adhering to safety-critical aerospace standards.
 * Milestone Support: Provide support for system-level and component-level milestones, such as Preliminary Design Review (PDR), Critical Design Review (CDR), and Test Readiness Review (TRR).
 * Regulatory Compliance: Collaborate with regulatory authorities like EASA to ensure our battery systems comply with safety and certification standards as needed.
   
   

Qualifications

Check in your professional skills:


 * Bachelor's or Master's degree in Electrical Engineering or a related field
 * Substantial knowledge of system engineering processes, particularly in aerospace or safety-critical applications
 * Proficiency in at least one requirements management tool (e.g., DOORS, Integrity)
 * Team player with the ability to lead technical discussions and effectively organize and execute tasks
 * Fluent in English
   
   

Preferred Skills:


 * Basic knowledge of high-voltage (HV) and Li-ion batteries, brushless DC motor control, DC power distribution, digital communication buses, and/or model-based systems engineering
 * Experience with Failure Modes and Effects Analysis (FMEA) and Failure Modes, Effects, and Criticality Analysis (FMECA)
 * Knowledge of aerospace standards and guidelines, such as ARP-4761, DO-254, DO-311, and DO-160
   
   

Additional Information

OurVolocopterflight includes:


 * Fast-growing high-tech company with a superb network of investors and partners 
 * Chance to shape the future of aviation
 * Help us to create groundbreaking new projects - from scratch! 
 * Personal accountability, as well as growth and learning opportunities, based on your personal strengths
 * An inspiring workplace with modern workspaces, flexible hours, quick decision-making, a flat hierarchy, positive leadership, great team spirit
 * Attractive compensation package
   
   

Diversity atVolocopter:

Our differences are what make us great.Here at Volocopter, we value equal opportunities and trust. As air mobility industry innovators, we believe that changing the world starts on team level.We are committed to fosteringanenvironment where everyone feels valued, respected, and empoweredtoreach their full potential.

title: FBW System Engineer - Pilot Controls (m/f/d)
description:
Company Description

Here at Volocopter, we are the pioneers of electric air taxis (electric vertical takeoff and landing aircraft - eVTOLs). We have pledged to bring sustainable urban air mobility to life by getting electric air taxis off the ground in a way that complements existing transportation options in megacities across the globe. In 2011 we carried out the first-ever crewed flight of a fully electric multicopter and have since conducted more than 2,000 public and private test flights across the world (www.volocopter.com).

Job Description

Your mission during this flight:

You are a Senior System engineer experienced in the development of complex systems and you are passionate about making a difference in eVTOL aviation. You have substantial experience in system architecture and requirements engineering and a profound knowledge of the verification and validation aspects in aviation, and in particular flight control system and pilot controls. Within a multi-disciplinary team, you will coordinate between the various teams and systems to ensure a successful certification of the pilot control input concept of the Volocopter aircraft. You will shape the future of how pilots control an eVTOL aircraft.


 * You will support with requirements management at flight control level with a focus on pilot controls (including e.g. functional-, safety-, regulatory-, environmental-, human factors, and performance requirements)
 * You will provide system-level expert for coordination and alignment with various internal departments, flight testing but also certification authorities
 * You will support with the generation of tests (including safety), drawings, and design specifications
 * You will coordinateand manage an external supplier
   
   

Qualifications

Check in your professional skills:


 * Engineering degree (MSc or higher), preferably in aerospace engineering
 * At least 6 years of professional experience in systems engineering for complex systems (ideally aviation-related and in flight control system and pilot controls)
 * Knowledge of aviation standards and guidelines (DO-160, DO-178, and DO-254 in line with the ARP4754A, ARP4761)
 * Knowledge of certification processes (Part 21) and requirements under EASA (CS-23,CS-25,CS-27,CS-29, ideally SC-VTOL).
 * Highly skilled and effective in technical writing and communicating with others
 * You have worked in V-Cycle and agile/scrum environments and have an awareness of the methodologies and used tools (e.g. Jira, SAFe)
 * Experience with systems engineering tools (e.g. DOORS, SysML, etc.)
 * Ideally theoretical knowledge about flight testing, flight physics or electrical systems

description:
Role: Systems and Application Engineering Manager

Location: Munich OR Geneva (Hybrid - 2 days wfh per week)




About the Company:

A leading global innovator in electrical measurement solutions, our client empowers customers to optimize, enhance reliability, and ensure safety within their energy and mobility systems. They transform technological potential into powerful solutions for megatrends like renewable energy, mobility, automation, and digitization. The innovative electrical solutions are accelerating the transition to a sustainable future for customers and society.







Key Responsibilities:

- Lead and develop a team of 5+ system/application engineers, fostering a culture of collaboration and continuous improvement.

- Prioritize team tasks and maintain effective communication with key stakeholders in product management, design, and management.

- Proactively champion the growth and development of team members.

- Lead the recruitment of new team members.

- Drive the team towards achieving critical objectives, including:

-- In-depth product knowledge: Develop and execute efficient characterization plans aligned with target specifications and applicable standards.

-- System-level product definition and requirements.

-- Comprehensive customer support through technical guidance, issue investigation, and reporting.

-- Building and documenting application understanding through customer interactions, research, and system simulations.

-- Development of innovative concepts to address customer challenges efficiently.

-- Management of the patent system architecture.

-- Definition of next-generation products and derivatives through system breakdown.







Qualifications:

- Bachelor's or Master's degree in Electronics.

- 5+ years of experience as an application engineer, system engineer, or product definer within a semiconductor company.

- Proven experience leading and motivating teams.

- Demonstrated experience with the automotive industry and ISO26262 standards.

- Strong foundation in electronics, power electronics, and/or sensors (plus).

- Curiosity and ability to lead investigations for resolving customer issues and understanding requirements.

- Proven ability to synthesize customer needs and deliver clear technical communication.




Soft Skills:

- Strong customer-focused mindset.

- Open, concise, and clear written and oral communication.

- Pragmatic and results-oriented approach.

- Ability to prioritize effectively.

- Team player and learner attitude.




To Apply:

If you are a passionate leader with a proven track record in the semiconductor industry and are excited to contribute to the success of a global innovator, we encourage you to submit your resume and cover letter. Due to confidentiality agreements, the company's name will not be disclosed initially.




We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Senior Project Engineer
description:
I am currently recruiting for a global EPC company for a senior project engineer. This is a great opportunity to be working on some of the worlds largest infrastructure projects.




In this role and working with the other members of the design team, you will design and manage HV Systems and Components, including plant and installation engineering. First to define the system requirements, design sub-systems and component definitions needed for it’s realisation, and finally managing the design integration.




Essential responsibilities

 * Under the role of Project Engineer – HV Systems, you shall be responsible for following technical scope, applicable for HVDC on-shore / off-shore project.
 * Lead the design of Plant Engineering systems, station layouts and installation drawings.
 * Manage the HV Components, RFQ to Delivery engineering co-ordination, interfacing with sub-systems.
 * Manage BOQ consolidated at project level.
 * Integrate system engineering requirements, controls and LV system interfaces, MEP and CW system interfaces.
 * Lead the conceptual designs and co-ordinate partners / other stake holders for overall system integration and client interface for AC networks.
 * Understand the customers’ requirements, regulatory constraints and standards that need to be adhered too and ensure that they are fully considered by all stakeholders.
 * Present the engineering options to internal stake holders and customers in order to gain agreement and progress to the next design stage.
 * Create the necessary documents and reports to articulate the proposed design and it’s benefits to the Customer.
 * Engage with the Customer, as required, to articulate the proposed design and answer questions or queries that may be raised.
 * Working with the installation and commissioning team, develop a testing regime to ensure that the system meets it’s functional and legislative obligations.




Qualifications and Skills

 * To succeed in this role, you will have the following qualification and experience:
 * A first degree in electrical engineering. (Or equivalent experience)
 * More than 5 years’ experience working in a role where you are the design and delivery of HV systems for an HVDC Project, and have a strong working knowledge of the following topics:
 * Scheduling of engineering activities, managing interfaces
 * Representing to client and other stake holders the integrated overall primary systems
 * You will be confident to discuss these topics with internal stakeholders & customers and be able to propose solutions or improvements needed to create successful designs that can then be delivered.
 * Experience in technical problem solving
 * Knowledge of Transmission or Distribution industry

title: Versuchsingenieur Sonderfahrzeuge (m/w/d)
description:
Unternehmensbeschreibung

Die Segula Technologies Experts GmbH ist - als Teil von Segula Technologies, einem global agierenden Engineering-Konzern in den Branchen Automobilindustrie, Energie, Schiene, Schifffahrt und Luftfahrt mit über 10.000 Mitarbeitern - ein unabhängiges Entwicklungs- und Beratungsunternehmen mit ca. 320 Mitarbeitern für Kunden der Automobil-, Nutzfahrzeug- und Luftfahrtindustrie mit Kernkompetenzen als Systementwicklungsdienstleister in Design und Konzept, Berechnung und Simulation, Maschinenbau und Konstruktion, Elektrik und Elektronik, Integration und Ergonomie sowie Prototyping und Absicherung.

Wir suchen für unseren Kunden, einer der führenden europäischen Nutzfahrzeughersteller, Sie als Versuchsingenieur Sonderfahrzeuge (m/w/d) am Standort München.

Stellenbeschreibung


 * Sorgfältige Planung und umfassende Dokumentation aller Validierungsprozesse, um höchste Qualitätsstandards zu gewährleisten.
 * Koordination und Organisation von Projekten im Versuch, um reibungslose Abläufe und erfolgreiche Ergebnisse sicherzustellen.
 * Erfassung und detaillierte Analyse von Messdaten, gefolgt von fundierten Interpretationen zur Unterstützung von Entscheidungsprozessen.
 * Durchführung umfassender Funktionstests an Sonderfahrzeugen einschließlich militärischer Fahrzeuge um deren Leistungsfähigkeit und Zuverlässigkeit zu überprüfen.
 * Erstellung klarer und strukturierter Versuchsberichte zur transparenten Darstellung der Ergebnisse und Erkenntnisse.
 * Regelmäßige Abstimmung in der Abteilung sowie mit der Werkstatt und weiteren Versuchsabteilungen
 * Anschauliche Präsentation der Ergebnisse vor internen und externen Stakeholdern, um die Erfolge und Fortschritte zu kommunizieren.
 * Systematische Erfassung und Nachverfolgung von Fahrzeugmängeln in einer Datenbank, um eine schnelle und effektive Problemlösung zu gewährleisten.
   
   

Qualifikationen


 * Abgeschlossenes Studium im Bereich Maschinenbau, Fahrzeugtechnik oder einer vergleichbaren Fachrichtung
 * Erfahrung in der Versuchsplanung und -durchführung, idealerweise im Bereich Sonderfahrzeuge
 * Fundierte Kenntnisse in der Messtechnik und Datenanalyse
 * Selbständige, eigenverantwortliche und kooperative Arbeitsweise
 * Kenntnisse in der Fahrzeug-(LKW)-Technik
 * Erfahrung im Umgang mit Messtechnik und Fzg.-CAN
 * LKW-Führerschein und -Fahrpraxis zwingend erforderlich
 * Teamfähigkeit, Kommunikationsstärke und eine strukturierte Arbeitsweise
 * Sehr gute Deutschkenntnisse
 * Hohe Kommunikations- und Teamfähigkeit
 * Fremdsprache Englisch – (Berichte, Normen, Aufträge in Englisch)
 * Bereitschaft zu Dienstreisen, auch ins Ausland
 * Standard MS-Anwendungen (Outlook, Excel, Word, …) sowie Tevis Datenbank
 * Messprogramme (Micro-Edition, CANalyzer, ControlDesk)

title: Information Technology System Engineer
description:
IT Systems Engineer




Start Date: as soon as possible

Type of employment: contract to end of September 2023

Number of Positions: 1

Location: Aachen, German (100% remote is also possible; CEST or EST time zones)

Language skills: Strong English communication skills are required.

Perks: Work with cutting-edge technology using sophisticated AI, as part of a passionate, dedicated team that thrives on meaningful innovation in a rapidly growing industry.




As a IT Systems Engineer, you will be responsible for maintaining and upgrading Ubuntu installations, managing Atlassian Bitbucket instances, administering JFrog Artifactory instances, setting up backup systems, and monitoring these systems. You will need expertise in Linux administration, application-level backups, and knowledge of source control systems.




Principal Duties and Responsibilities:

 * Update an in-production Ubuntu installation to the latest release.
 * Manage the Atlassian Bitbucket instance by monitoring its functionality, testing new releases, and implementing rollback procedures if necessary.
 * Administer the JFrog Artifactory instance, ensuring that it is up-to-date and functioning properly.
 * Collaborate with the IT department to set up a robust backup system for both the JFrog Artifactory and Atlassian Bitbucket instances.
 * Establish and maintain monitoring procedures for these systems to identify and resolve any problems or errors.
 * Stay up to date with emerging trends and technologies in the field to continually improve our systems and processes.




Education and certifications:

Bachelor's degree in computer science, information technology, or a related field




Required Skills:

 * Expertise in Linux administration
 * Experience in application-level backups
 * Knowledge of source control systems
 * Working expertise with Atlassian Bitbucket and/or JFrog Artifactory administration




Preferred Skills:

 * Fluency in English, with German language skills as a plus.
 * Experience in setting up backup systems and procedures.
 * Knowledge of networking and security protocols
 * Experience in DevOps practices and tools.

In return, you will be part of a creative and supportive team environment with the ability to have a direct impact on the development of top-tier games.

Are you up for the challenge?

title: Flight Test Specialist Engineer - Electric Propulsion System (m/f/d)
description:
Company Description

Here at Volocopter, we are the pioneers of electric air taxis (electric vertical takeoff and landing aircraft - eVTOLs). We have pledged to bring sustainable urban air mobility to life by getting electric air taxis off the ground in a way that complements existing transportation options in megacities across the globe. In 2011 we carried out the first-ever crewed flight of a fully electric multicopter and have since conducted more than 2,000 public and private test flights across the world (www.volocopter.com).

Job Description

Your mission during this flight:

You will be a member of our Flight Test Team, providing technical and operational expertise in Electric Propulsion Systems, (EPS) for Ground and Flight tests of crewed and uncrewed configurations. Tests will usually be conducted locally, (Bruchsal/Lahr) but may involve campaigns at remote locations from time to time.

You will work closely with our engineering and EPS rig testing teams to assist our flight testing process and to ensure the required readiness for test in time, on cost and quality. In addition, you will manage activities related to the aircraft DMU. As a Senior FTSE, you will be a mentor to more junior engineers, and have opportunities for technical guidance. Volocopter has an established Flight Test Organization as part of our EASA Part21J Design Organization Approval (DOA).


 * You are involved with planning, monitoring, and optimizing Ground and Flight Test activities for electric aircraft development and certification purposes on your specialities (EPS) for the overall functions of a complete aircraft
 * You assist withaircraft preparation, inspection, and repair pre/post-test
 * You take care of the mechanical integration of FTI systems into the aircraft and coordination of interfaces with affected systems
 * You are involved in the assessment and documentation of tests including troubleshooting and development of standardized analysis and reporting tools
 * You work on engineering projects, the solution of which requires technological advances and related development
   
   

Qualifications

Check in your professional skills:


 * Master’s degree in Aeronautical Engineering or equivalent technical education
 * 15+ years of experience as an Engineer involved in aeronautical development and certification process
 * Experience in electric propulsion systems
 * Experience in planning, monitoring and examining propulsion systems testing
 * Experience in Siemens NX or other CAD design and query tools
 * Knowledge of the English language at a professional level
   
   

Preferred skills:


 * Education or experience in rotorcraft flight testing
 * Aircraft MRO experience
 * Experience as an MRB/Liaison Engineer, or as a Flight Test Analysis Engineer/FTSE
   
   

Additional Information

OurVolocopterflight includes:


 * Fast-growing high-tech company with a superb network of investors and partners 
 * Chance to shape the future of aviation
 * Help us to create groundbreaking new projects - from scratch! 
 * Personal accountability, as well as growth and learning opportunities, based on your personal strengths
 * An inspiring workplace with modern workspaces, flexible hours, quick decision-making, a flat hierarchy, positive leadership, great team spirit
 * Attractive compensation package
   
   

Diversity atVolocopter:

Our differences are what make us great.Here at Volocopter, we value equal opportunities and trust. As air mobility industry innovators, we believe that changing the world starts on team level.We are committed to fosteringanenvironment where everyone feels valued, respected, and empoweredtoreach their full potential.

title: Application Software Engineer
description:
We are Isarsoft

We make every camera count

At Isarsoft we develop video analytics software to make transportation and cities more efficient, inclusive and secure. We stand for data protection and responsible processing of sensitive data. Being on the forefront of innovation we work together in interdisciplinary teams in a positive, fun and energetic atmosphere.

Our customers and partners are at the center of everything we do. Founded in 2019 we have grown organically winning large customers and partners delivering compelling, reliable, high-performance software. We are proud of being a privately held company with family atmosphere focusing on long-term relations to our customers and team members.

Your mission


 * Actively engage with customers to understand their needs and use cases for Isarsoft Perception
 * Work in tandem with the engineering team to align the product roadmap with the needs of current and potential customers
 * Ensure customer requirements are addressed by the engineering team and helping to prioritize them effectively
 * Partner with the sales team to identify customer requirements through in-depth technical conversations and workshops
 * Investigate new product development opportunities driven by the strategic understanding of customer needs
   
   

Your profile


 * Proven experience in direct interactions with end-users, either as an application engineer or developer
 * Knowledge of best practices in large-scale software development
 * Exceptional communication skills with a focus on resolving customer issues
 * Practical experience in SQL, Python, and using APIs/SDKs
 * Proficiency in both English and German
   
   

Additional Assets


 * Familiarity with Docker / Linux
 * Startup experience
   
   

Benefits


 * An experienced, highly motivated and international team to learn and grow
 * A high-impact work environment with flat hierarchies and short decision-making processes
 * Have the flexibility to work from anywhere: A great office in Garching nearby Munich, from home or the English-Garden
 * Free lunch, coffee and drinks at our office
   
   

Sounds good? We are just getting started. Let's build a great company together.

Hiring Process

We are committed to a transparent and fair hiring process. We aim for concluding the interview process in no longer than 3 weeks.

The following three stages are typical for any position at Isarsoft.


 * Video Interview with HR
 * Technical Deep Dive / Challenge
 * A personal meeting with the founders
   
   

We deeply believe that a great product only can be build by a great team. That's why sharing our values, being a team-player and having a energetic attitude is as important as bringing the right technical skills.

About Us

Learn more about Isarsoft

www.isarsoft.com

Follow us on social media

LinkedIn | YouTube | Twitter

Fun fact: Isar is the river flowing through the heart of Munich contributing to making it one of the most liveable cities in the world. Isarsoft Perception provides people-, and traffic flow analytics to enhance mobility, safety and live in cities across the globe.

Let's make every camera count!

title: System Engineer
description:
The Role

The Systems Engineer is part of the engineering team that develops marine navigation and bridge systems for OSI’s government and naval markets. The Systems Engineer plays a critical role in the development of the overall system requirements’ design and definition for OSI’s complex products. With offices globally, OSI Maritime Systems are now opening in Kiel, Germany. This role will be a part of the growth of this office.




Key Responsibilities

 * Assists senior engineers in developing design concepts and generates technical proposal material in response to Request for Quotation (RFQ)
 * Develops system designs, performs functional analysis, defines systems architecture, defines interfaces and specification, performs trade-studies and documents the design by writing SSDD, ICDs, SRS
 * Performs requirement analysis, traceability and maintenance of requirements
 * Coordinates design of subsystems and integration of total system
 * Identifies, analyzes and resolves program support deficiencies
 * Develops and recommends corrective actions
 * Designs to government standards, including Military and IMO standards, ensuring ongoing compliance and adherence to requirements
 * Ensures availability, reliability and other logistics support considerations are part of the system design process
 * Reviews obsolescence issues and recommends design changes
 * Attends and participates in customer design reviews and acceptance events
 * May participate in system integration tests, trials, and acceptance tests at customer facilities
 * Writes acceptance test procedures
 * Manages scope of work, schedules work, estimates effort and costs, and identifies technical risks; effectively communicates status on a regular basis to management




Qualifications

 * Degree in Engineering or Physics, Engineering or related field or equivalent experience
 * 4 years’ engineering experience, Minimum 3 years’ experience in Systems Engineering;
 * Experience in marine electronics and integrated bridge systems a significant asset; experience in defense or government domain preferably in naval ship sector a significant asset
 * Strong knowledge of marine navigation and tactical sensors or systems;
 * Excellent knowledge of Systems Engineering principles, standards and best practices;
 * Familiarity with requirements and verification management tools such as DOORS;

title: REQUIREMENTS ENGINEER (M/W/D)
Construction Site Systems Engineer
description:
Fluor GmbH is the German subsidiary of Fluor Corporation (USA) with office locations in Mannheim, Berlin and Ratingen. As an engineering services company with around 100 employees (30 000 around the world), we offer our clients solutions in industrial plants and infrastructure facilities in the areas of Energy Solutions and Advanced Technologies & Life Sciences with a focus on Engineering, Procurement and Construction Management (EPCM).




At Fluor, we are proud to design and build projects and careers. This requires teams that are as unique as the projects we execute. We are committed to fostering a work environment that embraces Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion (DE&I) for all so our employees and stakeholders benefit from the creative solutions derived because of embracing differences.




For our project site in Heide, Schleswig-Holstein, we are currently looking for Construction Site Systems Engineer to support our project team for the next two years as of now.




Construction Site Systems Engineer

Heide, Schleswig-Holstein, Germany (on site)




This role provides construction automation support and technical advice for projects, responsible for managing the project implementation and coordination of construction automation systems. (iConstruct,Synchro,Navisworks)




PRINCIPAL JOB DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:

 * Provide technical configuration and coordination of the support for construction systems
 * Communicate the data integration requirements between construction systems.
 * Stay current on research dealing with construction automation technologies and supported construction work practices with the ability to apply knowledge gained.
 * Perform construction related automation duties, and ensuring the uniformity of automation execution within Fluor's Operating System Requirements (OSR).
 * Maintain compliance with all applicable policies, procedures, and global standards.




BASIC JOB REQUIREMENTS:

 * Experience in using iConstruct, Navisworks and/or Synchro or equivalent 3D/4D systems.
 * 8 years of work-related experience.
 * Knowledge and understanding of project construction work processes either through project experience or training with specific knowledge regarding the interaction and exchange of knowledge between engineering disciplines, construction, vendors, contractors, and clients.
 * Work permit in Germany.
 * German language and English language.

- At the stage of recruitment: until the completion of the recruitment process, however, no longer than one year;

- At the stage of performance of the employment contract: during the term and after completion thereof, pursuant with the applicable laws.

- If you want us to retain your CV in our database, please place additionally in your CV the following consent: ”I agree to the processing by FLUOR S.A. of the personal data contained in my recruitment application for the purposes of future recruitments”. In such case, your personal data will be held for the period of 24 months from the submission of your application. You can at any time withdraw your consent through contacting us at the details: katarzyna.kudlek@fluor.com

6. In connection with the processing of your personal data by the Controller, you will have the following rights:

a) The Right to Access Your Personal Data

b) The Right to Rectify Your Personal Data

c) The Right to Complete Your Personal Data

d) The Right to Erase Your Personal Data (also called ”The Right to be Forgotten”)

e) The Right to Restrict the Processing of Your Personal Data

f) The Right to Transfer the Personal Data




If you want to exercise the rights as referred to above or receive additional information, you can contact the Controller using one of the options as below:

a) In writing to the address: FLUOR S.A. with registered seat in Gliwice, Poland, 11 Prymasa Stefana Wyszynskiego Street;

b) Sending an e-mail to: katarzyna.kudlek@fluor.com

c) Calling the telephone number: 32 239 10 51.




If you apply to the Controller with a request under any of the aforementioned rights, the Controller shall provide you with a response with respect to the examination of your request, without unnecessary delay; however, no later than one month from receipt of your request.




g) The Right to Lodge a Complaint with a Supervisory Authority

If you are of the opinion that the processing of your personal data takes place in breach of the laws, you will be entitled to lodge a complaint with the supervisory authority, i.e., the President of the Office of Personal Data Protection.




Your personal data provided by you is the prerequisite for being included in the process of recruitment for a job vacancy and entering into the future contract of employment. You are obligated to provide your personal data. If you fail to do so, you will not be considered as a candidate in the process of recruitment for job vacancy with all of the consequences thereof.
