title: RAMS Engineer
description:
Sécheron Hasler Group continues the Swiss tradition of over 140 years in the field of railway technology. We are a leading global supplier of electrical and electronic safety components and solutions and traction power systems for the railway industry and also provide solutions for renewable energy, DC grid, and other industrial systems. The name Sécheron Hasler

Group is worldwide synonymous with Swiss Quality and represents a leading reference for state-of-the-art products supplied to the market. With more than 1200 employees worldwide, we are wherever our customers are around the globe. We supply products approved in our customers' countries or markets and deliver top-notch supply chain and customer services locally.

You are responsible for implementing the activities related to Reliability, Availability, Maintainability, Safety (RAMS), and Life Cycle Costs (LCC). You will also be sporadically taking part in RAMS and safety training and courses.

The main tasks within this important and safety-relevant function are:


 * Analysis of electronic assemblies, creation of component models and implementation of reliability analyses
 * Contribution to the customer projects and product development projects as RAMS specialist
 * Coordination of activities in order to carry out Failure Mode and Effects Analysis (FMEA)
 * Checking customer-specific system configurations for compliance with the normative requirements for RAM/LCC
   
   
   

Requirements

As a Rams Engineer, you would have:


 * You have an electronics university degree (or similar), software knowledge is an advantage
 * You have very good communication and documentation skills in both French and English
 * You have at least three years of experience in RAMS/LCC in railway, automotive or aerospace industry
 * Basic knowledge of reliability prediction methods
 * Knowledge of EN 50126, EN 50128/EN 50657, EN 50129 is an advantage
 * Experience in a safety-related environment is an advantage
 * You are mentally flexible and thirsty for knowledge
 * You like to work autonomously as well as in a team and you want to pass on your specialized knowledge
 * You have the ability to identify and assess vulnerabilities, risks and opportunities
   
   
   

Benefits

What we offer:

We have flat hierarchies and encourage direct communication between departments and management levels. This allows us to make decisions quickly.

We give our employees full responsibility for their work tasks. We encourage all employees to take initiative and contribute to the operational excellence of the company, and we provide ample opportunities for them to achieve their personal and professional growth goals.

A valid work visa is required to apply for this position; unfortunately, we do not offer sponsorship.

How to apply:

Do you have a positive attitude and are you looking for a stimulating and rewarding work environment? If so, we look forward to receiving your application.

Sécheron Hasler Group is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment and welcomes applications from all sectors of the community.

For more information, please visit our website: https://www.secheron.com/

Looking for other opportunities? Visit our job site: https://www.secheron.com/careers/

description:

Flexible Arbeitszeiten I Homeoffice 60% I herausragendes Team & Unternehmenskultur I 30 Tage Urlaub I Moderne Ausstattung I Vergünstigungen & Exclusive Angebote I Hundefreundliches Büro

 * Verantwortung für die Konfiguration der Windows-Clients und iPhones mittels Microsoft Intune.

 * Betreuung der Telefonie-Infrastruktur (Audiocodes SBC und Microsoft Teams) zur Sicherstellung der optimalen Erreichbarkeit der Mitarbeiter.
 * Server-Patchmanagement über den Azure Update Manager.
 * Administration des Monitoring-Systems CheckMK.
 * Betreuung der Microsoft-Virtualisierungsumgebung (Hyper-V) sowie der Microsoft Azure Server.
 * Administration der hybriden Umgebung, bestehend aus lokalem AD, ADConnect und Azure AD, sowie der hybriden Mail-Umgebung mit Exchange 2016 und Exchange Online.
 * Ansprechpartner im 3rd Level Support für komplexe Fragestellungen der Teams.
 * Aktive Teilnahme an den monatlichen Patchdays.

Die Personalberatung SThree betreut die ausgeschriebene Stelle im Auftrag ihres Kunden.

Ihr Profil:

title: Testingenieur:in
description:

🤝Unser Arbeitsumfeld:

🎁Was wir Dir bieten:

Dann bewirb dich jetzt mit deinem Lebenslauf direkt über LinkedIN. Wir freuen uns auf deine Bewerbung!

title: AI Integrations Engineer (m/f/d) - Remote
description:
Empower businesses to succeed! At Sastrify, we're transforming how companies manage and procure their software - quickly, efficiently, and with maximum impact. Our mission? To save our clients time and money so they can focus on what truly matters.

Supporting Tech and Procurement teams in buying and managing their software, we deliver best practices and insights and a vast database of benchmarks.

We're thrilled to have secured $32 million in Series B funding, a milestone that fuels our passion for innovation and growth. Joining Sastrify means being part of a fast-paced, forward-thinking team where your work will make a real difference.

Ready to shape the future of SaaS management? Let's do it together! You'll be working closely with Maximilian Messing, our CTO.

What You'll Do As Our AI Integrations Engineer


 * Lead the integration of AI technologies within our SaaS platform, ensuring robust, scalable, and high-performance architectures
 * Collaborate with cross-functional teams to implement and enhance AI-driven features that improve user experience and platform efficiency
 * Design and develop APIs and data pipelines to integrate third-party AI solutions and large language models (LLMs) seamlessly, including popular AI services such as OpenAI, Anthropic, and other emerging providers
 * Develop and maintain Python-based data processing scripts for AI models and workflows
 * Oversee the entire lifecycle of AI applications, focusing on secure and efficient deployment and operation
 * Implement best practices in AI development, including continuous integration and delivery, and infrastructure as code
 * Collaborate closely with stakeholders to translate business requirements into scalable AI-driven solutions
 * Act as a thought leader in AI integration, promoting a culture of innovation and continuous improvement
   
   

Our Technologies


 * We build our products using TypeScript: React.js for the Front-End and Node.js for the Back-End
 * Our serverless architecture leverages AWS Lambda functions
 * We maintain fully automated CI/CD pipelines with daily production deployments
 * We use Terraform for infrastructure as code to manage our cloud environments
 * Our stack also includes Serverless Framework, PostgreSQL, TypeORM, Storybook, React Query, and a variety of AWS services (Bedrock and others)
   
   
   

Requirements


 * You are a seasoned engineer with 5-7 years of software development experience, including substantial expertise in JavaScript/TypeScript and relevant experience with AI technologies
 * You have strong experience with Python for AI-related development, including data processing and workflows with frameworks like Langchain, as well as integrating large language models (LLMs)
 * You have a proven track record of delivering high-quality AI solutions to production, including experience with cloud platforms such as AWS, GCP, or Azure, and integrating third-party AI services and large language models (LLMs)
 * You comprehensively understand the entire software and AI development lifecycle, from architecture through deployment and operations, including methodologies such as Agile and DevOps practices
 * You are passionate about fostering collaboration and driving technical innovation within teams, and have demonstrated leadership or mentorship in technical teams, such as guiding junior engineers or leading project initiatives
 * You are a strong communicator who enjoys problem-solving and collaborating across teams
 * You believe in continuous learning and are committed to driving technical and organizational improvements
 * You are fluent in English and thrive in a remote work environment (we do not have an office)
 * You are located in Germany or Spain
   
   
   

Benefits


 * Build deep technical and market expertise in the rapidly growing SaaS market
 * Take full responsibility from day one, with opportunities to shape our product and engineering practices
 * Work with our amazing international team (we have Sastronauts from 30+ different nationalities)
 * Work fully remotely - we do not have an office.
 * 30 days of vacation
 * Flexible working hours
 * Learning budget
 * State-of-the-art equipment and equipment budget
 * In-person Gatherings
 * Mental health support
   
   

The Talent Acquisition Manager for this role is Frieda Möcker. Feel free to reach out to her with any questions!

As an equal employment opportunity employer, Sastrify is committed to promoting an inclusive work environment. We want all of our employees to feel valued, appreciated, and free to be who they are at work, regardless of race, colour, ancestry, religion, gender, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, or veteran status.

title: Full-Stack Software Engineer (m/f/d) -  Java
description:
Your mission

We are looking for a talented and driven Full Stack Software Engineer to join our Customer Platform team. Certivity is a tech startup that digitizes the way how product makers manage regulatory requirements to be compliant. As a Full Stack Software Engineer, you will be working with the latest innovative technologies to develop and maintain our cloud SaaS (Software as a Service) application.

Your profile

If you love coding and taking ownership of features on both front- and back-end side, you appreciate code reviews and the result of clean code conventions, and you are a learner who wants to constantly improve, Certivity is looking for you.

Your Profile


 * You have a tech or computer science degree is preferred, but not necessary if you know how to code
 * Strong proficiency in front-end technologies such as React, Angular, or Vue
 * Solid experience in back-end technologies such as Java or Node.js
 * Experience with relational and/or NoSQL databases
 * Strong understanding of software development principles, design patterns, and best practices
 * Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills
 * Effective communication and collaboration skills
 * Ability to work in a fast-paced, agile environment
 * You are in Munich, or based in Germany
 * Fluent spoken and written English (company language is English)
   
   

Why us?

Founded in 2021, Certivity is a young startup in the field of RegTech (Regulatory Technology). Everyone in our team loves solving complex problems and is passionate about building software. You have the chance to work with industry experts in both software as well as regulatory domain to be onboarded with a super-fast learning curve.

Apart From That We Offer


 * Fair compensation, flexible working schedules, free choice of when and where you want to work
 * Stock options to share in our company's success
 * A mission-driven startup culture in a comfortable environment: we value leisure time, family, and friends & open communication
 * A team that is very welcoming to new members, we are embracing each other and learn from our mutual experiences, celebrate together, and have fun at work.
 * Pick any laptop and we get it for you.
 * Free drinks (water, tea, coffee, beer) and snacks in our offices.
 * Regular team events (eating out, karaoke).
 * Dynamic team, dynamic software: your creativity and ideas make a difference from the start!
 * Modern tech stack
 * 
    * Front-end: React + TypeScript + Tailwind CSS
    * Back-end: Java on Spring Boot + MongoDB
      

Closing

We welcome candidates from all backgrounds and encourage diversity in our team. We encourage female engineers to apply and join our mission-driven culture that values open communication, work-life balance, and a welcoming environment. Convince us with your personality and your skills - and together we will make great things happen!

About Us

Founded in 2021, we at Certivity are a young, creative, and dynamic team of highly skilled domain experts working on innovative RegTech Software. Our solution will shape and define the term “RegTech” as we develop a completely new product for the highly complex and not yet digitized environment of product regulations. Our primary focus is the automotive industry, with options to expand to many other domains as well. Our B2B cloud platform bundles all relevant tasks for compliance with vehicle regulations and laws. For more information about us and our product have a look at our website.

title: Junior Requirements Engineer (m/w/d)
description:
WORUM ES GEHT

Du baust dabei mit an unseren GovTech-Lösungen der nächsten Generation, die den Alltag von Millionen von Menschen einfacher machen. Unterstütze uns bei der Umsetzung unserer Vision, den Staat fit für das 21. Jahrhundert zu machen. Denn starke und funktionierende Institutionen sind die Grundlage einer funktionierenden Demokratie.

Werde Teil unseres Software-Testing-Teams und unterstütze Deine Kolleg*innen tatkräftig in der Steigerung der Produktqualität für unsere beiden größten Entwicklungsbereiche SINC CASES oder e²A. Du arbeitest aktiv an der Qualitätssteigerung mit und bringst unsere Projekte mit Deinem Einsatz jeden Tag ein Stück weiter. Schließ Dich uns an und werde Teil der SINC Familie.

DEINE AUFGABEN


 * Als Mitglied unseres Teams organisierst, analysierst und klärst Du externe und interne Anforderungen für unser Beihilfe-Softwareprodukt und erstellst die Akzeptanzkriterien, ggf. auch im Kontakt mit unseren Kunden.
 * Du erstellst und pflegst die Anforderungsdokumentationen unter Verwendung von Tools wie JIRA und Confluence.
 * Du bereitest Test- und Testdaten vor, unterstützt und überwachst deren Ausführung, analysierst die Testergebnisse und erstellst im Bedarfsfall Fehlermeldungen.
 * Du unterstützt kontinuierlich bei der Erarbeitung und Pflege von manuellen und automatisierten Regressionstests.
 * Du bildest die Schnittstelle zwischen unseren internen und externen Stakeholdern (Kunden) und unseren internen Entwicklungsteams.
 * Du unterstützt bei der Pflege der Anwendungsdokumentation und führst ggf. auch Anwenderschulungen beim Kunden durch.
   
   

WAS DU MITBRINGST


 * Nach Deinem Studium, entsprechender langjähriger Berufserfahrung oder Deiner Fach-Ausbildung in einer Krankenversicherung, Beihilfestelle oder in anderer abrechnender Tätigkeit im Gesundheitswesen hast Du bereits Erfahrung im Bereich des Anforderungsmanagements, der Qualitätssicherung und bist IT-affin.
 * Du bringst Erfahrung in der systematischen Bearbeitung von Anforderungen und Testplanerstellung mit und hast Spaß bei der Umsetzung der zugrundeliegenden Methoden und Techniken.
 * Eine ISTQB Zertifizierung, idealerweise ISTQB Certified Test-Analyst (Advanced Level), ist ein Bonus, aber kein Muss.
 * Du bist strukturiert, selbstständig und teamfähig und gehst auch bei abstrakten und komplexen Herausforderungen stets analytisch vor.
 * Du kannst Dich in Deutsch sowohl auf der technischen als auch auf der fachlichen Ebene klar und strukturiert ausdrücken.
 * Du empfindest konstante Qualitätsverbesserung als positive Herausforderung.
   
   

WAS WIR BIETEN


 * Du möchtest Beruf und Privatleben unter einen Hut bekommen? Wunderbar. Genieße flexible Arbeitszeiten. 60% Deiner Arbeit kann von Zuhause stattfinden.
 * Wir bezahlen heute schon Dein zukünftiges Ich. Wenn Du mal in Rente gehst, haben wir jeden Monat 302€ für Dich im Rahmen der betrieblichen Altersvorsorge zur Seite gelegt.
 * Wir investieren in Dich durch regelmäßige Fort- und Weiterbildungen. Das Tolle ist, Du kannst auch täglich von Deinen erfahrenen Kolleg*innen lernen.
 * Komm schnell von A nach B mit Deinem eigenen JobRad.
 * Wir feiern gerne mit Dir und Deiner Familie - ob auf dem Sommerfest, Weinfest oder der Weihnachtsfeier. Alle sind eingeladen.
 * Wachse mit Deinem Team auf großartigen Events zusammen. Ob Bouldern, Grillabend oder Trampolinhalle, lass Deiner Fantasie freien Lauf.
   
   

INTERESSE AN DIESEM JOB?

Dann lass uns gemeinsam herausfinden, ob wir zueinander passen. Entwickle Deine tollen Ideen nicht länger für den Papierkorb, sondern für einen sinnvollen Zweck.

Alternativ kannst Du uns die Bewerbung auch an bewerbung@sinc.de schicken.

Wenn noch Fragen offen sind, dann melde Dich gerne direkt bei Tuba.

Tuba Tanik

Recruiting

tuba.tanik@sinc.de

title: System Engineer
description:
Location: Erlangen, Germany

Employment Type: Full-time




About Us

At Interherence, we develop cutting-edge optical detection systems and intelligent image analysis platforms for characterizing single bionanoparticles, such as viral vectors, proteins, and single molecules. Our innovative technologies combine precision optics and advanced algorithms, empowering researchers and industries worldwide.




Built on a culture of collaboration and inclusivity, our diverse team thrives on pushing the boundaries of optical microscopy and single-particle detection. Join us in shaping the future of bionanoparticle analysis and making a meaningful impact.




Position Overview

We are seeking a skilled and enthusiastic System Engineer to join our team. The ideal candidate will have a hands-on mentality, a strong technical background, and a proven ability to work across disciplines such as optical microscopy, electronics, and programming. In this role, you will play a critical part in the development, integration, and optimization of complex systems, ensuring they meet the high standards our customers demand.




Key Responsibilities

·      Design, develop, and implement system-level solutions for advanced microscopy instruments. 

·      Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including R&D, manufacturing, and software development, to ensure seamless system integration.

A home where people learn and thrive

title: Requirements Engineer (m/w/d)
description:
Energiewende

Alle reden darüber, bei meteoviva gestalten wir sie aktiv mit. Bring deine Qualifikation ein, um mit uns daran zu arbeiten, dass der Energieverbrauch von Gebäuden optimiert und CO2 sowie Energie effizient eingespart werden

Dein Potenzial in Aktion!

Du erstellst präzise, verständliche und umsetzbare Anforderungsdokumente (z.B. Lastenhefte, Use Cases, User Stories) für unsere Smart Data Lösungen. Zur Ermittlung der Anforderungen führst Du Workshops und Interviews mit den beteiligten Parteien durch. Diese Anforderungen priorisierst Du basierend auf Geschäftszielen und technischer Machbarkeit.

Während des Entwicklungsprozesses klärst Du Rückfragen mit den Entwicklerteams und validierst die implementierten Lösungen im Vergleich zu den ursprünglichen Anforderungen. Dabei arbeitest Du eng mit dem Projektmanagement zusammen, um sicherzustellen, dass Anforderungen im Zeit- und Budgetrahmen umgesetzt werden können.

Deine Must-Haves


 * Abgeschlossenes Studium in Informatik, Wirtschaftsingenieurwesen, Wirtschaftsinformatik oder eine vergleichbare Qualifikation
 * Mehrjährige Berufserfahrung im Requirements Engineering, Business Analysis oder in der Softwareentwicklung
 * Fundiertes Wissen in der Anforderungserhebung, -dokumentation und -management
 * Erfahrung in der Anwendung von agilen Methoden (z.B. Scrum, Kanban) und der Erstellung von User Stories
 * Ausgeprägte analytische Fähigkeiten und die Fähigkeit, komplexe Sachverhalte verständlich aufzubereiten
 * Hervorragende Kommunikations- und Moderationsfähigkeiten
 * Strukturierte und ergebnisorientierte Arbeitsweise
 * Kenntnisse im Umgang mit gängigen Tools wie Jira, Confluence oder ähnlichen Anforderungsmanagement-Systemen
   
   

Deine Vorteile


 * hybrides Arbeiten oder Opendesk in Aachen
 * moderne Ausstattung
 * betriebliche Altersvorsorge
 * jährliche Bonuszahlung
 * attraktive Vergütung
 * 30 Tage Urlaub
   
   

Über uns

Wir setzen uns mit voller Energie dafür ein, dass Gebäude weniger Energie verbrauchen, und verwenden dazu intelligente Smart-Data-Lösungen wie meteoviva Climate. Dabei legen wir nicht nur Wert auf Innovation, sondern auch auf die Schaffung eines herausragenden Arbeitsumfelds. Unsere Mitarbeiter schätzen das gute Arbeitsklima, die Wertschätzung, die soziale Komponente und die Offenheit im Team. So tragen wir dazu bei, den Energieverbrauch von verschiedenen Gebäuden – darunter Büros, Flughäfen und Shopping-Center – zu optimieren, CO2 sowie Energie effizient einzusparen und bieten Raum für persönliches und berufliches Wachstum. Bei meteoviva bist du nicht nur Teil eines Teams, sondern ein Mitgestalter der Zukunft einer nachhaltigen Energiewende.

title: IT System Engineer
description:
Our satellite ground systems are valued by our customers for their reliability and performance. The "Project IT" team designs these systems and is responsible for the regular maintenance, care and regeneration of the components and continuous further development. We are looking for you to operate and constantly improve our systems. As an IT systems engineer, you are instrumental in our success!

Your tasks


 * As an IT systems engineer, you will be responsible for the implementation of IT projects in the field of satellite ground systems
 * As a technical manager, you communicate with internal and external stakeholders
 * You will create tasks for the IT system specialists and IT operations and ensure the implementation
 * Technical challenges appeal to their ambition and spirit of research
 * You design IT systems to meet customer requirements
 * You will ensure compatibility with the technical interfaces in the project
 * You will be in direct contact with the project management and draw up schedules for the implementation of the IT system
 * You will advise on the technologies used, drawing on the expertise of IT specialists
 * You will support new projects and proposal teams in the design phase and translate project requirements into IT infrastructure requirements
 * You will support the test team in carrying out tests in the implementation phase
 * In addition, you can take on the responsibility of being a service owner
 * They ensure the quality of the documents requested in the project
   
   

Your Qualifications


 * You have a degree with a focus on IT and several years of professional experience in the project environment or a comparable qualification
 * You have a broad interest in IT and technology and are an expert in at least one subject area
 * You are familiar with common processes and products for project and IT service management (ITIL, Jira, Confluence, MS Project)
 * You can motivate employees and instruct them professionally
 * You have an overview of complex relationships in the project and can present them
 * You have a high sense of responsibility
 * You like to communicate in a solution-oriented, convincing and friendly manner
 * Knowledge of Jira, MS Project, i-doit and the Office components is desirable
 * You have written and spoken German and English skills
 * They are not perfect! Together, we want to further promote your professional development

title: Requirements Analyst/Engineer (m/w/x)
description:
Das erwartet dich bei uns

In agiler Teamarbeit und unter Verwendung der neuesten Technologien entwickelst du Software, welche die digitale Zukunft der öffentlichen Verwaltung nachhaltig voranbringt.

Dabei hilfst du uns den Staat menschlicher zu machen in dem du z.B. junge Menschen, durch eine koordinierte Unterstützung verschiedener Beratungsstellen, den optimalen Weg in die Eigenständigkeit finden lässt oder du die Bereitstellung von Online-Zugängen für Bürgerdienste realisierst.

 * Konsequente Anwendung von modernen Methoden und Tools aus dem agilen Requirements Engineering
 * Mitarbeit in innovativen Digitalisierungsprojekten
 * Vertrauensvolle Zusammenarbeit mit dem Product Owner auf Kundenseite
 * Analyse von Geschäftsprozessen und Design von Lösungskonzepten




Das bringst du mit




 * Erfahrung im Requirements Engineering in großen Projekten mit unterschiedlichen Stakeholdern
 * Interesse an der Arbeit in einem Scrum-Team und Spaß an agiler Teamarbeit
 * Mehrjährige Berufserfahrung im Umfeld der Softwareentwicklung
 * Das Interesse und die Weitsicht, die digitale Zukunft mitzugestalten




Bei infoteam sind wir überzeugt: Nur motivierte, begeisterte und zufriedene Mitarbeitende können die Art von herausragender Software entwickeln, die wir und unsere Kunden so sehr schätzen. Für uns ist die Vereinbarkeit von Privatleben, Familie und Beruf deshalb sehr wichtig und flexible Arbeitszeiten und die Möglichkeit auf Homeoffice ist für uns selbstverständlich. Wir lachen gerne während der Arbeit und schätzen kurze Wege mit flachen Hierarchien. Gegenseitige Unterstützung, Vertrauen und Begeisterung für die Arbeit stehen im Mittelpunkt unserer Unternehmenskultur.

title: System Engineer
description:
Location: Erlangen, Germany

Employment Type: Full-time




About Us

At Interherence, we develop cutting-edge optical detection systems and intelligent image analysis platforms for characterizing single bionanoparticles, such as viral vectors, proteins, and single molecules. Our innovative technologies combine precision optics and advanced algorithms, empowering researchers and industries worldwide.




Built on a culture of collaboration and inclusivity, our diverse team thrives on pushing the boundaries of optical microscopy and single-particle detection. Join us in shaping the future of bionanoparticle analysis and making a meaningful impact.




Position Overview

We are seeking a skilled and enthusiastic System Engineer to join our team. The ideal candidate will have a hands-on mentality, a strong technical background, and a proven ability to work across disciplines such as optical microscopy, electronics, and programming. In this role, you will play a critical part in the development, integration, and optimization of complex systems, ensuring they meet the high standards our customers demand.




Key Responsibilities

·      Design, develop, and implement system-level solutions for advanced microscopy instruments. 

·      Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including R&D, manufacturing, and software development, to ensure seamless system integration. 

·      Troubleshoot and optimize optical, electronic, and software components.

·      Manage and oversee projects from conception to completion, ensuring on-time delivery and adherence to specifications.

·      Document processes, configurations, and testing procedures.

·      Provide technical support and training to customers and internal teams.




Qualifications and Skills

Experience: 3-5 years of professional experience in system engineering or related fields. Prior experience working in a startup environment is considered a plus.

Technical Expertise:

·      Hands-on experience with optical microscopy and instrumentation.

·      Proficiency in electronics and hardware integration.

·      Programming skills in languages such as Python, C++, or MATLAB.

·      Project Management: Proven ability to manage complex projects effectively, meeting deadlines and ensuring quality.




Soft Skills:

·      Problem-solving mindset and the ability to work in a fast-paced environment.

·      Strong interpersonal skills for effective collaboration with team members and clients.




Language Skills:

·      English fluency is mandatory.

·      German language skills are a plus.




Why Join Us?

title: System Engineer
description:
Our client is seeking a Network Engineer with strong Linux and networking knowledge, along with scripting language experience, to join their team in Munich, Germany. The role is hybrid, requiring both on-site and remote work. The ideal candidate will have proficiency in German (B2) and English (C1), with extensive knowledge of Linux systems, networks, and automation tools.

Technologies


 * Python, Bash, Perl
 * Linux (Debian, CentOS)
 * Git
 * MySQL
   
   

Requirements


 * 3+ years of programming experience in at least one scripting language (Bash, Perl, or Python preferred).
 * Strong Linux and networking knowledge, with command line proficiency.
 * Experience with Icinga, Puppet, Hiera, Linux KVM, Git, Facter, Ansible, or MySQL is a plus.
 * Knowledge of monitoring tools, switches, routers, firewalls, and load balancers.
 * German (B2 level) and English (C1 level) proficiency required.
 * Ability to work hybridly in Munich, Germany.
   
   

Responsibilities


 * Plan, design, and maintain the company's intercontinental network across six global locations.
 * Optimize the data center packet switching infrastructure for reliability, low latency, and throughput.
 * Ensure network security using OpenBSD firewalls and connect to customers via leased lines and VPN.
 * Extend and develop automated network configuration tools using 100% open-source software (e.g., Ansible, Python).
 * Participate in a rotating on-call system (about one week every five, fully compensated).
 * Assist with maintaining around 600 Linux servers (Debian 12, CentOS 8).
 * Opportunity to broaden skills by learning new technologies such as Kubernetes and Puppet.
   
   

Skills: linux kvm,kubernetes,firewalls,git,facter,python,vpn,scripting,networking,ansible,perl,bash,openbsd,switches,puppet,icinga,linux,hiera,monitoring tools,routers,mysql,load balancers
